captions.hook: that voice telling you you're not good enough
captions.value:
self-loathing is exhausting. you fail at something and the inner critic makes sure you never forget it.

but here's the thing â€” people who truly don't care would never beat themselves up. your pain is proof you want to be better
captions.cta: if this resonates, save it for a hard day

captions.hook: you apologize for existing and you don't even realize it
captions.value:
"sorry" for taking up space. "sorry" for having needs. "sorry" for being you.

self-loathing teaches you to shrink. recovery starts when you stop apologizing for being human

captions.hook: the cruelest person in your life is the voice in your own head
captions.value:
you would never say those things to a friend. so why is it okay to say them to yourself?

today, try catching one cruel thought and asking: "would I say this to someone I love?"

captions.hook: "i hate myself" â€” a thought you've had more times than you can count
captions.value:
self-hatred feels permanent but it's actually a learned pattern. you weren't born hating yourself. someone or something taught you.

what was learned can be unlearned. slowly. imperfectly. but possible

captions.hook: everyone else seems to like themselves. why can't you?
captions.value:
comparison is self-loathing's best friend. it feeds on the gap between who you are and who you think you should be.

the gap isn't real. it's a story your brain tells to keep you stuck
captions.cta: share this with someone who's too hard on themselves
